did.abstract: The records include minutes, reports, correspondence, and election results of the Brooklyn City Library spanning the period 1839 to 1843. The Brooklyn City Library was a subscription library incorporated in 1839 and located in the Brooklyn Lyceum Building, where it operated until 1851.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The bound Act of Incorporation and By-Laws was the gift of John Jay Pierrepont, date unknown. Source and date of acquisition for the remaining materials unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1979.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn City Library was a subscription library incorporated in 1839 and located in the Brooklyn Lyceum Building, where it operated until 1851. One of the founders was Henry Cruse Murphy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn City Library records, 1979.001, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024. At that time, the bound Act of Incorporation and By-Laws was removed from its very damaged binding and the pages foldered with the rest of the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records include minutes, reports, correspondence, and election results of the Brooklyn City Library spanning the period 1839 to 1843. There is also a handwritten text titled Act of Incorporation and By-Laws of the Brooklyn City Library.
